articles.headline: Road to New Life After Katrina Is Closed to Many
articles.snippet: Nearly two years later, going home to New Orleans is a receding dream for thousands of evacuees.
articles.abstract: Nearly two years later, going home to New Orleans is a receding dream for thousands of evacuees.
articles.lead_paragraph: CONVENT, La. — This was not how Cindy Cole pictured her life at 26: living in a mobile home park called Sugar Hill, wedged amid the refineries and cane fields of tiny St. James Parish, 18 miles from the nearest supermarket. Sustaining three small children on nothing but food stamps, with no playground, no security guards and nowhere to go.

articles.headline: U.P.S. Embraces High-Tech Delivery Methods
articles.snippet: The United Parcel Service has embraced the latest methods to improve deliveries and air safety.
articles.abstract: The United Parcel Service has embraced the latest methods to improve deliveries and air safety.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — Worldport, the United Parcel Service hub at the airport here, gives new meaning to the phrase “hub of activity.” On a peak night, workers have less than four hours to process more than a million packages from at least 100 planes and probably 160 trucks.

articles.headline: Bush to Declare Gains in Iraq on Some Fronts
articles.snippet: A White House report will cite satisfactory progress on some benchmarks but will  qualify other verdicts by saying it is too early to make final judgments.
articles.abstract: A White House report will cite satisfactory progress on some benchmarks but will  qualify other verdicts by saying it is too early to make final judgments.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 11 — The Bush administration will assert in the next few days that progress in carrying out the new American strategy in Iraq has been satisfactory on nearly half of the 18 benchmarks set by Congress, according to several administration officials.
articles.byline: By David S. Cloud and John F. Burns

articles.headline: Cameras That Swim With the Fishes
articles.snippet: Sanyo, Olympus and Pentax have introduced waterproof camera/camcorders that come surf-ready.
articles.abstract: Sanyo, Olympus and Pentax have introduced waterproof camera/camcorders that come surf-ready.
articles.lead_paragraph: When you enter your golden years and sit back to enjoy the home videos of your youth, you might realize that your life’s record is missing two huge genres. First, your home movies probably show only the happy and momentous times; nobody films the sad and lonely times.

articles.headline: Whole Foods Executive Used Alias
articles.snippet: For seven years, John P. Mackey, the co-founder of Whole Foods Market, had an online alter ego.
articles.abstract: For seven years, John P. Mackey, the co-founder of Whole Foods Market, had an online alter ego.
articles.lead_paragraph: John P. Mackey, the co-founder of Whole Foods Market, has never lacked for personality.

articles.headline: A Nuclear Ruse Uncovers Holes in U.S. Security
articles.snippet: Investigators set up a bogus company and bought materials that could be used in a so-called dirty bomb.
articles.abstract: Investigators set up a bogus company and bought materials that could be used in a so-called dirty bomb.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 11 — Undercover Congressional investigators set up a bogus company and obtained a license from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission in March that would have allowed them to buy the radioactive materials needed for a so-called dirty bomb.

articles.headline: China Not Sole Source of Dubious Food
articles.snippet: Federal records suggest that China is not the only country that has problems with its exports.
articles.abstract: Federal records suggest that China is not the only country that has problems with its exports.
articles.lead_paragraph: Black pepper with salmonella from India. Crabmeat from Mexico that is too filthy to eat. Candy from Denmark that is mislabeled.
articles.byline: By Andrew Martin and Griff Palmer

articles.headline: For Parking Space, the Price Is Right at $225,000
articles.snippet: As real estate elsewhere languishes, Manhattan property is still escalating in price, and that includes parking spots.
articles.abstract: As real estate elsewhere languishes, Manhattan property is still escalating in price, and that includes parking spots.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Houston, $225,000 will buy a three-bedroom house with a game room, den, in-ground pool and hot tub.
